intro: Morus hachijoensis, commonly known as the Hachijo mulberry, is a rare species native to the Japanese island of Hachijō-jima. It is a deciduous tree belonging to the Moraceae family, characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, aggregate fruits. The plant thrives in humid, subtropical climates and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and conservation status, it is considered an important species for botanical research and ecological studies.
